Package utility

Class Sort

  • java.lang.Object
    • utility.Sort
  • public class Sort
extends java.lang.Object
    The `Sort` class provides static methods for sorting arrays using various sorting algorithms. It supports sorting in both ascending and descending order based on the provided comparator.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Sort()

      • mergeSort

        private static <T> void mergeSort​(T[] array,
                                  T[] tempArray,
                                  int left,
                                  int right,
                                  java.util.Comparator<? super T> c)
        Recursively sorts the specified array using the Merge Sort algorithm with the given comparator.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of elements in the array.
        Parameters:
        array - The array to be sorted.
        tempArray - An auxiliary array to store intermediate results.
        left - The index of the leftmost element of the subarray.
        right - The index of the rightmost element of the subarray.
        c - The comparator to determine the order of elements.

      • merge

        private static <T> void merge​(T[] array,
                              T[] tempArray,
                              int left,
                              int mid,
                              int right,
                              java.util.Comparator<? super T> c)
        Merges two sorted subarrays into a single sorted subarray.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of elements in the array.
        Parameters:
        array - The array containing the subarrays to be merged.
        tempArray - An auxiliary array to store intermediate results.
        left - The index of the leftmost element of the first subarray.
        mid - The index of the rightmost element of the first subarray.
        right - The index of the rightmost element of the second subarray.
        c - The comparator to determine the order of elements.

      • partition

        private static <T> int partition​(T[] array,
                                 int low,
                                 int high,
                                 java.util.Comparator<? super T> c)
        Partitions the array around a pivot element.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of elements in the array.
        Parameters:
        array - The array to be partitioned.
        low - The index of the leftmost element of the subarray.
        high - The index of the rightmost element of the subarray.
        c - The comparator to determine the order of elements.
        Returns:
        The index of the pivot element after partitioning.
